Nov 05, 2024 

[Lilium Launches M&A Process with KPMG, Targets Program Continuation Towards First Flight and Certification](/news-releases/news-release-details/lilium-launches-ma-process-kpmg-targets-program-continuation)

KPMG mandated for a structured M&A process – first investor briefings to start soon Local court approved insolvency filings of Lilium’s German subsidiaries and appoints custodian and Chief Insolvency Officers (CIOs) The Lilium business remains fully focused on re-emerging following restructuring;

Oct 24, 2024 

[Lilium Board approves application for self-administration of German subsidiaries](/news-releases/news-release-details/lilium-board-approves-application-self-administration-german)

Follows German parliament´s Budget Committee not approving a loan guarantee that was a condition precedent to a private fundraise Company was also unable to reach an agreement in principle with Bavarian government to guarantee a €50 million loan Application for self-administration proceedings

Oct 23, 2024 

[Lilium, GE Aerospace partner to deliver eVTOL flight safety](/news-releases/news-release-details/lilium-ge-aerospace-partner-deliver-evtol-flight-safety)

Two companies combining their flight data and analytics platforms to inform eVTOL flight safety standards Lilium to deploy GE technology to all Lilium Jet operators, starting with Lilium’s own flight test campaign GE Aerospace’s Event Measurement System (EMS) is used globally by 60 airlines and

Oct 01, 2024 

[Lilium Powers On First Lilium Jet in Significant Milestone Towards First Flight](/news-releases/news-release-details/lilium-powers-first-lilium-jet-significant-milestone-towards)

Systems power-on paves the way for start of Lilium Jet ground testing campaign The first Lilium Jet – MSN 1 – will be used to confirm safety for first piloted flight planned for early 2025 MSN 2, the first aircraft that Lilium will fly with a pilot on board, is now in final assembly MUNICH, Oct.

[New landmark international study: 2-in-3 People Agree: Now Is The Time for Air Travel to Become Sustainable](/news-releases/news-release-details/new-landmark-international-study-2-3-people-agree-now-time-air)
